Posts.Content: gina_momof3 wrote: My name is Gina.  I'm 38.  On July 23 I was diagnosed with right side invasive ductal carcinoma.  My tumor grew very fast moving up surgery to before chemo and to be done on the same day as my port placement and lymph node biopsy.  It (the tumor) was 10.5 cm when they removed it.  Amazingly enough though I had no lymph node involvement.  The surgeon couldn't believe it.  My tumor was triple negative, so I won't be a candidate for hormone therapy.  I should have the results of my genetic testing on Friday.  I start chemo on Friday.  I'm very nervous.  I guess everyone is the first time.  I'll have chemo every 3 weeks for 6 times.  Then hopefully I'll get a break before radiation starts.  Do you ladies have any tips for preventing nausea?  I know I'll get meds, but I was thinking something more natural to try.  I'm also worried about the fatigue I'll feel.  I'm a homeschooling mom of 3 and I want to try to keep the kids on track as much as possible.  Surgery 8/1/2012 Lymph node removal: Right; Mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 8/24/2012 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hi, new here gina_momof3 Hope999
